controls.name: Security and Compliance Officer
controls.description:
Designate an individual at the organizational level (e.g., Chief Information Security Officer) responsible for (1) cybersecurity and (2) governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) functions.

This can be one person responsible for and accountable for both areas, or one person accountable for both areas. (NIST CSF2.0 GV.RR‑02, CISA CPGs 1.B)

controls.name: Vulnerability Identification
controls.description: Remediate Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEVs) within 14 calendar days; other vulnerabilities (non-KEVs) assessed as Critical must be remediated within 15 calendar days; those assessed as High must be remediated within 30 calendar days. (NIST CSF 2.0 ID.RA‑01 and 08, CISA CPGs 1.E)

controls.name: Vulnerability Disclosure
controls.description: Remediate Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEVs) within 14 calendar days; other vulnerabilities (non-KEVs) assessed as Critical must be remediated within 15 calendar days; those assessed as High must be remediated within 30 calendar days. (NIST CSF 2.0 ID.RA‑01 and 08, CISA CPGs 1.E)

controls.name: Vendor Risk Policy
controls.description: Document and maintain all vendor/supplier agreements for covered systems (e.g., third-party network connection agreements), including contractual IT and cybersecurity requirements. (NIST CSF2.0 GV.SC‑05, 06, 07, 10, CISA CPGs 1.G, 1.H, 1.I)

controls.name: Network Topology
controls.description: Develop and maintain an accurate network topology covering the system, and to the greatest extent possible, establish connections with any networks interfacing with the covered system to facilitate understanding of asset interconnections and assist in timely identification and response to incidents. (NIST CSF2.0 ID.AM-03, CISA CPGs 2.P)

controls.name: Asset Allowlist
controls.description: Adopt and implement management policies that include manual or automated processes requiring approval before installing or deploying new hardware, firmware, or software/software versions in covered systems. (NIST CSF2.0 GV.PO‑02, ID.RA‑09, ID.AM‑08, PR.PS‑01, 02, 03, CISA CPGs 2.Q)

controls.name: Incident Response Plan
controls.description: Develop and maintain an incident response plan applicable to covered systems, which should be reviewed annually and updated as appropriate. (NIST CSF 2.0 ID.IM‑04, CISA CPGs 2.S, 5.A)

controls.name: Authentication Policy
controls.description: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) on all covered systems, or where MFA cannot be implemented, require passwords with sufficient strength, including adequate length of 16 characters or longer. (NIST CSF 2.0 PR.AA‑03, PR.AA‑04, CISA CPGs 2.B, 2.H)

controls.name: Identity Assertion Protection
controls.description: Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) on all covered systems, or where MFA cannot be implemented, require passwords with sufficient strength, including adequate length of 16 characters or longer. (NIST CSF 2.0 PR.AA‑03, PR.AA‑04, CISA CPGs 2.B, 2.H)

controls.name: Human Resources Security
controls.description: For any individual with access to covered systems, immediately revoke any credentials assigned to that individual upon termination or role change. (NIST CSF 2.0 GV.RR‑04, PR.AA‑01 and PR.AA‑04, CISA CPGs 2.D)

controls.name: Identity Management
controls.description: For any individual with access to covered systems, immediately revoke any credentials assigned to that individual upon termination or role change. (NIST CSF 2.0 GV.RR‑04, PR.AA‑01 and PR.AA‑04, CISA CPGs 2.D)

controls.name: Access Deprovisioning
controls.description: For any individual with access to covered systems, immediately revoke any credentials assigned to that individual upon termination or role change. (NIST CSF 2.0 GV.RR‑04, PR.AA‑01 and PR.AA‑04, CISA CPGs 2.D)

controls.name: Log Records
controls.description: Collect logs of events related to access and security (for example, intrusion detection systems/intrusion prevention systems, firewalls, data loss prevention, virtual private networks, login failure event detection), and store such logs for detection and incident response activities (for example, forensics to assist with detection, response, and recovery). Notify cybersecurity personnel when critical log sources (for example, operating system event logging tools) are disabled.

controls.name: Usage Monitor
controls.description: Collect logs of events related to access and security (for example, intrusion detection systems/intrusion prevention systems, firewalls, data loss prevention, virtual private networks, login failure event detection), and store such logs for detection and incident response activities (for example, forensics to assist with detection, response, and recovery). Notify cybersecurity personnel when critical log sources (for example, operating system event logging tools) are disabled.

controls.name: Asset Monitor
controls.description: Collect logs of events related to access and security (for example, intrusion detection systems/intrusion prevention systems, firewalls, data loss prevention, virtual private networks, login failure event detection), and store such logs for detection and incident response activities (for example, forensics to assist with detection, response, and recovery). Notify cybersecurity personnel when critical log sources (for example, operating system event logging tools) are disabled.

controls.name: Data-at-Rest Protection
controls.description: Maintain organizational policies and processes to ensure that unauthorized media and hardware do not connect to protected assets, such as by restricting the use of Universal Serial Bus (USB) devices and removable media or by disabling automatic execution.

controls.name: Physical Access Control
controls.description: Maintain organizational policies and processes to ensure that unauthorized media and hardware do not connect to protected assets, such as by restricting the use of Universal Serial Bus (USB) devices and removable media or by disabling automatic execution.

controls.name: Organization Security Policy
controls.description: Maintain organizational policies and processes to ensure that unauthorized media and hardware do not connect to protected assets, such as by restricting the use of Universal Serial Bus (USB) devices and removable media or by disabling automatic execution.

controls.name: Deny by Default
controls.description: Implement configurations to deny by default all connections to covered systems and any networks where covered systems are located, except for connections explicitly allowed for specific system functions.RetryClaude can make mistakes. Please double-check responses.

controls.name: System Access Restriction
controls.description: Publish and manage at the organizational level the identities and credentials of authorized users, services, and hardware, with sufficient attributes to prevent protected personnel or countries of concern from accessing protected data. Restrict system access to the types of transactions and functions that authorized users are permitted to perform.

controls.name: Data Risk Assessment
controls.description: Conduct and document data risk assessments that evaluate whether and how the overall approach and measures selected and implemented according to Section II are sufficient to prevent protected personnel and/or countries of concern from accessing protected data, taking into account the likelihood of disclosure and potential harm based on the nature of the transaction and related data, including potential data misuse and associated consequences. The risk assessment should include a mitigation strategy that outlines how implementation will prevent protected personnel and/or countries of concern from accessing protected data. The risk assessment should be reviewed annually and updated as appropriate.

controls.name: Data Detention Policy
controls.description: Maintain and implement written data retention and deletion policies, and review them annually and update as appropriate. (NIST Privacy Framework GV.PO-P1, CT.PO-P2)

controls.name: Data Collection and Disclosure
controls.description: Information systems that implement such processing are covered systems subject to the requirements of Part I. (NIST Privacy Framework CT.DP-P4, CM.AW-P3, GV.PO-P2)

controls.name: Data Encryption
controls.description: Comprehensive encryption: Encrypt covered data in restricted transactions, regardless of type, using industry-standard encryption during transmission and storage. (NIST Privacy Framework CT.DP-P1, PR.DS-P1, PR.DS-P2, CISA CPGs 2.K)

controls.name: Data-in-Transit Protection
controls.description: Transport Layer Security (TLS): Transmit covered data in restricted transactions over the internet using only Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 or higher protocols. (NIST Privacy Framework CT.DP-P1 and PR.DS-P2, CISA CPGs 2.K)

controls.name: Key Management
controls.description: Key management: Generate and securely manage encryption keys used to encrypt covered data, including the following practices (NIST Privacy Framework CT.DP-P1 and PR.DS-P2, CISA CPGs 2.L)

controls.name: Privacy Enhancing Technologies
controls.description: The application of privacy-enhancing technologies should not reveal to relevant personnel the covered data participating in restricted transactions or information that could reasonably be used to reconstruct covered data, including through linking processed data with other datasets. (For example, covered personnel are not permitted to participate in privacy-preserving computations that require trusted parties).

controls.name: Identity and Access Management
controls.description: Configure the identity and access management technologies outlined above to deny authorization for all protected personnel and countries of concern to access protected data within protected systems.
